title: STEAM Project-Based Learning Assessment Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Fundamental Science and Engineering Concepts, and Proficiency in Digital Tools
context.additional_context: Enhancing STEAM project evaluation competencies applicable in primary and secondary education settings

learning_goals: Learners can evaluate whether STEAM project learning objectives and activities balance science, technology, engineering, arts, and mathematics competencies.
Learners can analyze the interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary integration level of a STEAM project using 21 evaluation criteria.

Learners can analyze three or more core elements (e.g., difficulty level, engagement, real-world relevance) to consider when designing STEAM projects tailored to elementary, middle, and high school levels, propose at least one project design suitable for each level, and achieve an 80% or higher satisfaction rate in peer reviews and instructor feedback.

resources: Case Analysis Report on Spanish Secondary Education

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
